alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Imperial Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 16 at 6:57PM PST until January 17 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Imperial County and Imperial Valley. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
